data.title: The 50+ Best NBA Minnesota Timberwolves Small Forwards
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 50+ Best NBA Minnesota Timberwolves Small Forwards. Current Top 3: Anthony Edwards, Wally Szczerbiak, Andrew Wiggins ...
data.text:
Ranked By

1.8K votes

250 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Minnesota Timberwolves

Big fan of Minnesota basketball? Then check out this list of Minnesota Timberwolves small forwards. It includes almost every small forward from throughout Minnesota Timberwolves history, including current small forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA small forwards of all time, the best Timberwolves SFs include Andrew Wiggins, Wally Szczerbiak, Latrell Sprewell, Sam Mitchell, and Doug West.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Minnesota Timberwolves starting SFs and backup SFs are Anthony Edwards, Taurean Prince, and Jake Layman.

Who are the best small forwards in Minnesota Timberwolves history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Minnesota Timberwolves small forward of all time!

Most divisive: Wesley Johnson

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 50+ Best NBA Minnesota Timberwolves Small Forwards

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2020-2022

The young and dynamic Anthony Edwards made his way to the Minnesota Timberwolves as the first overall pick in the 2020 NBA Draft. With an explosive style of play, Edwards has quickly established himself as a force to be reckoned with on the court. His 2021 Rookie of the Year campaign showcased his incredible athleticism and scoring ability, promising a bright future for both Edwards and the Timberwolves. As the franchise continues to build around this young star, his place among the greatest Timberwolves small forwards is already secure.

2

Wally Szczerbiak

Age: 47

Birthplace : Madrid, Spain

Nationality : Spanish

Team : Boston Celtics, Cleveland Cavaliers, Minnesota Timberwolves, Seattle Supersonics

Position : Small forward

Minnesota Timberwolves: 1999–2006

An integral part of the Minnesota Timberwolves' history, Wally Szczerbiak joined the team as the sixth overall pick in the 1999 NBA Draft. Known for his prolific scoring and sharpshooting from beyond the arc, Szczerbiak was a matchup nightmare for opposing defenses. His tenacity and consistent play earned him an NBA All-Star selection in 2002 while playing for the Timberwolves. As one of the franchise's most beloved players, Szczerbiak's time in Minnesota will always be remembered as a highlight for the organization.

Birthplace : Markham, Thornhill, Canada

Nationality : Canada

Team : Golden State Warriors

Position : Small foward

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2014–2020

Drafted by the Cleveland Cavaliers and then traded to the Minnesota Timberwolves in 2014, Andrew Wiggins quickly emerged as a vital part of the franchise's future. Known for his exceptional athletic ability and scoring prowess, Wiggins became a Rookie of the Year recipient in 2015 while donning the Timberwolves' uniform. His solid play throughout his tenure with the team made him a cornerstone piece of the lineup. Even though Wiggins eventually moved on to Golden State, his time in Minnesota remains a crucial chapter for both the player and the organization.

Birthplace : Milwaukee, Wisconsin

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2003–2005

Acquired by the Timberwolves in a blockbuster trade back in 2003, Latrell Sprewell instantly became a fan-favorite with his fearless and aggressive playing style. As a key contributor to the team's deep playoff run during the 2003-2004 season, Sprewell's impact on the organization was undeniable. With an innate ability to score and defend multiple positions, he was viewed as the missing piece for a squad that had its sights set on championship contention. Although he failed to capture a title in Minnesota, Sprewell left a lasting impression on the fans and organization alike.

Birthplace : Columbus, Georgia

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Small forward

Minnesota Timberwolves: 1989–1992, 1995–2002

Drafted by the Houston Rockets in 1985, Sam Mitchell signed with the Minnesota Timberwolves during their inaugural season in 1989. Mitchell quickly became a crucial player for the young franchise, providing solid defense, rebounding, and veteran leadership. Over his two tenures with the team, Mitchell left his mark with strong performances on both ends of the court. He remains an essential figure in the Timberwolves' history, having also coached the team later in his career.

Birthplace : Portland, Tennessee, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Denver Nuggets

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Minnesota Timberwolves: 2007–2011, 2013–2014

Joining the Minnesota Timberwolves as the seventh overall pick in the 2007 NBA Draft, Corey Brewer quickly established himself as a tenacious defender and an adept scorer on the fast break. With his high motor and relentless pursuit of loose balls, Brewer was a fan favorite for his energy and hustle. His well-rounded skill set helped the Timberwolves maintain a strong presence on the wing. Although his tenure in Minnesota was split between two separate stints, Brewer's impact on the franchise remains significant.
